name: World Cup 2002: Group F Quiz | FIFA World Cup | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Sweden.

	Sweden beat England into second place by winning the group on goals scored. Sweden scored four goals and conceded three, while England had scored two and conceded one.

questions.text: England vs Sweden: Sol Campbell gave England an half-time lead, but who scored a leveller for Sweden?
questions.explanation:
Niclas Alexandersson.

	Campbell opened the scoring in the 24th minute, only for Alexandersson to equalize in the 59th minute.

questions.text: Argentina vs Nigeria: Who scored the only goal of the game?
questions.explanation:
Gabriel Batistuta (Argentina).

	Nigeria fought bravely in this game, but Batistuta's 63rd minute header gave Argentina the points.

questions.text: Sweden vs Nigeria: Who scored both of Sweden's goals as they ran out 2-1 winners?
questions.explanation:
Henrik Larsson.

	Nigeria took the lead in the 27th minute through Julius Aghahowa, but Larsson levelled in the 35th, then scored a penalty in the 63rd minute to give Sweden the victory.

questions.text: Argentina vs England: In what minute did David Beckham score what turned out to be the winning penalty?
questions.explanation:
44th.

	Having been sent off against Argentina in France '98, Beckham laid the ghost to rest and gained revenge.

questions.text: Argentina vs England: Who hit the woodwork with a great effort in the first half?
questions.explanation:
Michael Owen (England).

	England had most of the chances in the game, Argentina came back strong, but England's defence held out to win the game.

questions.text: Sweden vs Argentina: The game finished 1-1, but who had a penalty saved in the match?
questions.explanation:
Ariel Ortega (Argentina).

	Sweden's goalkeeper, Magnus Hedman, saved the penalty only for Crespo to pounce on the loose ball to earn Argentina an equalizer. Needing a win in the last game of the group, the score was not good enough for Argentina and were sent crashing out of the world cup at the first hurdle.

questions.text: Nigeria vs England: What was the full-time score in this match?
questions.explanation:
Nigeria 0 England 0.

	Needing a draw in this last game of the group was good enough for England to progress, while Nigeria were sent home finishing botton of the group.

questions.text: Who did Sweden go on to meet in the second round?
questions.explanation:
Senegal.

	Sweden would be beaten 2-1 by Senegal after Henri Camara scored a golden goal.

questions.text: Who did England, as runners-up in the group, go on to meet in the second round?
questions.explanation:
Denmark.

	England would beat Denmark 3-0, with goals from Rio Ferdinand, Michael Owen and Emile Heskey.
